title: Contributing to glysmith
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("glycoverse/glysmith", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: AI-Powered Workflow in Glysmith
text: using LLMs incur costs, extremely affordable glysmith workflows. Generating blueprint AI-driven report typically costs less $0.01 per run, offering professional-grade assistance fraction cent.
code: library(glysmith)

title: AI-Powered Workflow in Glysmith
text: Instead manually browsing selecting various step_xxx functions manage parameters, can describe analysis goals plain English (language). inquire_blueprint() translate requirements structured analytical blueprint. providing experiment object (exp), LLM can understand data structure experimental design, ensuring generated blueprint tailored specific dataset. function also prints brief rationale chosen steps console.
code: # Describe your goals in natural language bp <- inquire_blueprint("I want to perform DEA and visualize the results.", exp = your_exp) print(bp)

title: AI-Powered Workflow in Glysmith
text: initial blueprint needs adjustment, can use modify_blueprint() refine iteratively without starting scratch.
code: # Add or remove steps using natural language new_bp <- modify_blueprint(bp, "Also include a PCA analysis.", exp = your_exp) print(new_bp)

title: AI-Powered Workflow in Glysmith
text: polish_report() uses robust default rules, setting use_ai = TRUE unlocks advanced AI capabilities report generation: AI mode, LLM performs several high-level tasks: Structural Optimization: Dynamically arranges sections, text, figures optimal flow. Contextual Narrative: Drafts descriptive text analysis section. Multimodal Interpretation: Uses vision-capable models interpret explain generated figures. Professional Finishing: Polishes titles subtitles publication-ready look.
code: polish_report(result, "report.html", use_ai = TRUE)

title: AI-Powered Workflow in Glysmith
text: entire pipeline, raw data finished report, can simplified intelligent steps:
code: # 1. Generate an analysis plan bp <- inquire_blueprint("Perform DEA and visualize key findings.", exp = your_exp)  # 2. Execute the analysis res <- forge_analysis(your_exp, bp)  # 3. Export data and intermediate results quench_result(res, "analysis_output/")  # 4. Generate an AI-enhanced report polish_report(res, "report.html", use_ai = TRUE)

what: Analyze your data with a single line of code
title: Get Started with glysmith
text: demonstrate using built-experiment object glyexp. N-glycoproteomics dataset containing 12 samples across four different liver conditions: healthy controls (H), hepatitis (M), cirrhosis (Y), hepatocellular carcinoma (C), 3 samples group. Please note, dataset raw normalized imputed. work data, can use glyread import outputs tools like pGlyco3, MSFragger-Glyco, Byonic; Alternatively, can create experiment object. details, see Get Started glyread Creating Experiments. Now, let’s run default analysis pipeline just single line code. ’s ! ’ve completed following steps one go: Preprocessed data using glyclean::auto_clean() generated QC plots. Summarized experiment glyexp::summarize_experiment(). Performed principal component analysis glystats::gly_pca(). Conducted differential expression analysis using glystats::gly_limma(). Plotted volcano plot via glyvis::plot_volcano(). Generated heatmap significant glycoforms using glyvis::plot_heatmap(). Conducted GO enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_go(). Performed KEGG enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(). Performed Reactome enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(). Derived site-specific traits using glydet::derive_traits(). Conducted differential trait analysis glystats::gly_limma(). Generated heatmap significant site-specific derived traits via glyvis::plot_heatmap(). comprehensive analysis pipeline!
code: real_experiment #>  #> ── Glycoproteomics Experiment ────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ Expression matrix: 12 samples, 4262 variables #> ℹ Sample information fields: group <fct> #> ℹ Variable information fields: peptide <chr>, peptide_site <int>, protein <chr>, protein_site <int>, gene <chr>, glycan_composition <glyrpr_c>, glycan_structure <glyrpr_s> result <- forge_analysis(real_experiment) result

Running create folder path//save following content: README.md: Describes saved outputs. experiment.rds: processed experiment object. meta.rds: metadata list. plots/: plots generated pipeline. tables/: tables output analysis. Give try !
code: quench_result(result, "path/to/save")

code: polish_report(result, "path/to/save/report.html")

title: Get Started with glysmith
text: may noticed unusual names package. First, ‘smith’ glysmith doesn’t refer surname; ’s taken “blacksmith”—someone makes repairs items made iron. functions classes named using blacksmith jargon. example, forge_analysis() “forging” results, quench_result() “quenching” results save , polish_report() “polishing” report improve readability. ’ll learn “blueprint” next section.

title: Get Started with glysmith
text: Imagine visit blacksmith order sword. simply say, “want sword,” blacksmith use default blueprint start working . However, always option bring design—custom blueprint—smith can use sword. Similarly, forge_analysis() uses default blueprint analysis pipeline. can inspect via blueprint_default(). blueprint list steps executed sequentially. can use blueprint() step_ functions create custom blueprint. instance, ’d just like perform differential expression analysis plot volcano plot, : can also save blueprint file reload later: list available steps: step_ident_overview(): Summarize experiment identification. step_preprocess(): Preprocess experiment data generate QC plots. step_pca(), step_tsne(), step_umap(): Dimension reduction data exploration. step_dea_limma(), step_dea_ttest(), step_dea_anova(), step_dea_wilcox(), step_dea_kruskal(): Differential expression analysis various methods. step_volcano(): Create volcano plots DEA results. step_heatmap(): Generate heatmaps expression data. step_roc(): Perform Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) analysis. step_sig_enrich_go(), step_sig_enrich_kegg(), step_sig_enrich_reactome(): Functional enrichment analysis significant items. step_derive_traits(): Calculate glycan derived traits. step_quantify_motifs(): Quantify glycan motifs (substructures). start building blueprints, rules keep mind: step_preprocess() generally first step, ’s optional perform preprocessing manually glyclean. steps require others executed first. example, step_volcano() requires least one step_dea_limma(), step_dea_ttest(), step_dea_wilcox() run beforehand. Consult documentation step check dependencies. include duplicate steps within blueprint. instance, can’t add step_dea_limma() twice blueprint. step overwrites data produced earlier step, warning issued. example, including step_dea_limma() step_dea_ttest() overwrite dea_res data former latter step. Ignore warning ’s intend. can create branches blueprint using br(). Check document examples. Happy forging!
code: blueprint_default() #>  #> ── Blueprint (13 steps) ── #>  #> • step_ident_overview() #> • step_preprocess() #> • step_plot_qc(when = "post") #> • step_pca() #> • step_dea_limma() #> • step_volcano() #> • step_heatmap(on = "sig_exp") #> • step_sig_enrich_go() #> • step_sig_enrich_kegg() #> • step_sig_enrich_reactome() #> • step_derive_traits() #> • step_dea_limma(on = "trait_exp") #> • step_heatmap(on = "sig_trait_exp") bp <- blueprint(   step_preprocess(),   step_dea_limma(),   step_volcano(), ) result <- forge_analysis(real_experiment, bp) result write_blueprint(bp, "path/to/save/bp.rds") bp <- read_blueprint("path/to/save/bp.rds")

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
code: blueprint(   step_preprocess(),   step_pca(),   step_dea_limma(),  # this comma is ok ) #>  #> ── Blueprint (3 steps) ── #>  #> • step_preprocess() #> • step_pca() #> • step_dea_limma()

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: blueprint contains following steps: step_ident_overview(): Summarize experiment using glyexp::summarize_experiment(). step_preprocess(): Preprocess data using glyclean::auto_clean(). step_plot_qc(= "post"): Plot QC plots using glyclean::plot_qc(). step_pca(): Principal component analysis using glystats::gly_pca(), plot PCA using glyvis::plot_pca(). step_dea_limma(): Differential analysis using glystats::gly_limma(). step_volcano(): Plot volcano plot using glyvis::plot_volcano(). step_heatmap(= "sig_exp"): Plot heatmap using glyvis::plot_heatmap(). step_sig_enrich_go(): Perform GO enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_go(). step_sig_enrich_kegg(): Perform KEGG enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(). step_sig_enrich_reactome(): Perform Reactome enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(). step_derive_traits(): Derive traits using glydet::derive_traits(). step_dea_limma(= "trait_exp"): Differential trait analysis using glystats::gly_limma(). step_heatmap(= "sig_trait_exp"): Plot heatmap using glyvis::plot_heatmap().

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
code: blueprint_default(preprocess = TRUE, enrich = TRUE, traits = TRUE)

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: preprocess Whether include step_preprocess(). enrich Whether include enrichment steps, .e. step_sig_enrich_go(), step_sig_enrich_kegg(), step_sig_enrich_reactome(). traits Whether include derived trait analysis steps, .e. step_derive_traits() step_dea_limma(= "trait_exp").

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: glysmith_blueprint object.

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default

what: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
title: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
text: glysmith provides high-level, end--end workflows glycomics glycoproteomics data analysis within glycoverse ecosystem. acts orchestrator integrates data cleaning, quality control, derived trait computation, motif detection, statistical testing, visualization unified, one-command analytical pipelines. Featuring AI-assisted pipeline generation, glysmith can intelligently translate natural language research questions executable analysis blueprints, streamlining complex bioinformatics workflows. Built top experiment() data container domain-knowledge-aware infrastructure provided glyclean, glydet, glymotif, glystats, glyvis, related packages, glysmith enables users quickly forge polished tables, figures, analysis reports suitable publication. package designed reproducibility ease use, allowing novice advanced users obtain standardized structure-aware results minimal code retaining full flexibility customization.

title: Create a Blueprint using Natural Language — inquire_blueprint
text: description description want analysis. exp Optional. glyexp::experiment() object provide context LLM. group_col column name group variable experiment. Default "group". model Model use. Default "deepseek-chat". max_retries Maximum number retries AI output invalid. Default 3.

title: Create a Blueprint using Natural Language — inquire_blueprint
text: LLMs can unstable. get error, try another description. Make sure examine returned blueprint carefully ensure want. can also create parallel analysis branches br("name", step_..., step_...), namespace outputs branch prefix. LLM needs required information proceed, may ask clarifying questions interactively retry answers. blueprint generated, description printed , interactive sessions, can press ENTER accept type new requirements refine blueprint. review step can repeat accept plan. examples works: "want know pathways enriched differentially expressed glycoforms." "want heatmap pca plot. already performed preprocessing ." "glycomics dataset. want calculate derived traits perform DEA ."

title: Step: Adjust Protein Abundance — step_adjust_protein

title: Step: Adjust Protein Abundance — step_adjust_protein
code: fake_pro_expr_mat <- matrix(rnorm(100), nrow = 10, ncol = 10) rownames(fake_pro_expr_mat) <- paste0("P", seq_len(10)) colnames(fake_pro_expr_mat) <- paste0("S", seq_len(10)) fake_pro_expr_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".rds") saveRDS(fake_pro_expr_mat, fake_pro_expr_path) step_adjust_protein(fake_pro_expr_path) #> <step "step_adjust_protein(pro_expr_path = fake_pro_expr_path)"> Protein #> adjustment

title: Step: Correlation Analysis — step_correlation
text: Name experiment run correlation analysis . Can "exp", "sig_exp", "trait_exp", "sig_trait_exp", "motif_exp", "sig_motif_exp". on_cor character string specifying correlate. Either "variable" (default) correlate variables/features, "sample" correlate samples. method character string indicating correlation coefficient computed. One "pearson" (default) "spearman". p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. plot_width Width plot inches. Default 7. plot_height Height plot inches. Default 7. ... Additional arguments passed glystats::gly_cor().

title: Step: Correlation Analysis — step_correlation
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Correlation Analysis — step_correlation
text: Data required: exp (= "exp"): experiment run correlation analysis trait_exp (= "trait_exp"): trait experiment run correlation analysis motif_exp (= "motif_exp"): motif experiment run correlation analysis Tables generated (suffixes): correlation: table containing pairwise correlation results columns: variable1, variable2 (sample1, sample2 = "sample") cor: Correlation coefficient p_val: P-value correlation test p_adj: Adjusted p-value (p_adj_method NULL) Plots generated (suffixes): correlation: correlation matrix heatmap

title: Step: Correlation Analysis — step_correlation
text: section AI inquire_blueprint() . Include step explore relationships variables samples. careful use sample size variable number large (> 50). using step large data, ask user want proceed.

Default "time". event_col Column name sample information containing event indicator (1 event, 0 censoring). Default "event". p_adj_method Method adjusting p-values. See p.adjust.methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. ... Additional arguments passed glystats::gly_cox().

title: Step: Cox Proportional Hazards Model — step_cox
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Cox Proportional Hazards Model — step_cox
text: Data required: exp (= "exp"): experiment run Cox regression trait_exp (= "trait_exp"): trait experiment run Cox regression motif_exp (= "motif_exp"): motif experiment run Cox regression experiment must contain survival data time_col event_col columns sample information. Tables generated (suffixes): cox: table containing Cox regression results columns: variable: Variable name coefficient: Regression coefficient (log hazard ratio) std.error: Standard error coefficient statistic: Wald test statistic p_val: Raw p-value Wald test hr: Hazard ratio (exp(coefficient)) p_adj: Adjusted p-value (p_adj_method NULL)

title: Step: Cox Proportional Hazards Model — step_cox
text: section AI inquire_blueprint() . Include step users want identify variables associated survival outcomes. step requires survival data (time event columns) sample information. Always ask column names survival data, unless explicitly provided.

title: Step: Cox Proportional Hazards Model — step_cox
code: step_cox() #> <step "step_cox()"> Cox proportional hazards model step_cox(time_col = "survival_time", event_col = "death") #> <step "step_cox(time_col = \"survival_time\", event_col = \"death\")"> Cox #> proportional hazards model step_cox(on = "sig_exp", p_adj_method = "bonferroni") #> <step "step_cox(on = \"sig_exp\", p_adj_method = \"bonferroni\")"> Cox #> proportional hazards model of significant variables

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: Name experiment data ctx$data run analysis . Default "exp" differential expression analysis. Use "trait_exp" differential trait analysis. Use "motif_exp" differential motif analysis. p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. filter_p_adj_cutoff Adjusted p-value cutoff filtering. filter_p_val_cutoff Raw p-value cutoff filtering. filter_fc_cutoff Fold change cutoff filtering. filter_on Name test filter . Default "main_test". Can also "post_hoc_test". filter_comparison Name comparison filter . ... Additional arguments passed stats::aov().

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
text: Name experiment data ctx$data run analysis . Default "exp" differential expression analysis. Use "trait_exp" differential trait analysis. Use "motif_exp" differential motif analysis. p_adj_method character string specifying method multiple testing correction. Must one methods supported stats::p.adjust(). Default "BH" (Benjamini-Hochberg). Set NULL skip p-value adjustment. covariate_cols (gly_limma()) character vector specifying column names sample information include covariates limma model. Default NULL. subject_col (gly_limma()) character string specifying column name sample information contains subject identifiers paired comparisons. Default NULL. ref_group character string specifying reference group. NULL (default), first level group factor used reference. used two-group comparisons. contrasts character vector specifying custom contrasts. NULL (default), pairwise comparisons automatically generated, levels coming first factor used reference group. Supports two formats: "group1-group2" "group1_vs_group2". Use second format group names contain hyphens. "group1" used reference group. filter_p_adj_cutoff Adjusted p-value cutoff filtering. filter_p_val_cutoff Raw p-value cutoff filtering. filter_fc_cutoff Fold change cutoff filtering. ... Additional arguments passed limma::lmFit().

title: glysmith 0.9.1
text: Update dependency strategy use r-universe repo.

title: glysmith 0.9.0
text: Add loadings screeplot parameters step_pca() optional generation loading plots scree plots. Add check_glysmith_deps() checking installing optional dependencies required blueprint steps. forge_analysis() now checks dependencies installed actual analysis.

title: glysmith 0.9.0
text: Add ReactomePA Suggests pathway enrichment analysis.

title: glysmith 0.8.1
text: Fix bug step_quantify_motifs() bisecting GlcNAc regarded branching GlcNAc. Fix failing test introduced dplyr 1.2.0.

title: glysmith 0.8.0
text: Implemented single-question flow inquire_blueprint() modify_blueprint() streamlined user experience. Q&context now preserved modifying blueprints modify_blueprint(). Improved error messages steps branches missing dependencies. Fun fact now displays start AI interactions. Enhanced LLM prompting atomic question guidance better clarification questions. Changed default model deepseek-reasoner deepseek-chat.

title: glysmith 0.7.0
text: step_preprocess() now generate QC plots anymore. QC plots now generated step_plot_qc().

title: glysmith 0.7.0
text: Add step_plot_qc() generating Quality Control plots. Add step_cox() Cox proportional hazards survival analysis. Add step_correlation() correlation analysis. Add step_sig_boxplot() generating boxplots significant variables. Add step_plsda() step_oplsda() supervised dimensionality reduction. inquire_blueprint() now includes sample_info var_info summaries LLM context better suggestions. modify_blueprint() now clarification question capability.

title: glysmith 0.7.0
text: Improved LLM prompt vague inputs minimal blueprints inquire_blueprint(). Added Hmisc Suggests step_correlation() dependency. inquire_blueprint() UI optimized. Optimize speed inquire_blueprint() modify_blueprint(). AI prompts steps updated. Per-plot width height now customizable step functions.

title: glysmith 0.6.0
text: Add step_adjust_protein() adjusting glycoform quantification protein expression. Add step_logo() generating logo plots. inquire_blueprint() now asks clarifying questions better understand user requirements. inquire_blueprint() now asks user confirm blueprint returning .

title: glysmith 0.6.0
text: inquire_blueprint() better UI/UX. Updated system prompt inquire_blueprint() improve understanding step usage. Fixed bug inquire_blueprint() access step parameters. Fixed bug Windows file paths generated LLM parsed.

title: glysmith 0.5.1
text: Depends glyclean 0.10.0.

title: glysmith 0.5.0
text: report structure (sections include, orders figures text chunks, etc.) now determined LLM. Titles, subtitles, figure titles now polished LLM. text description figure now generated LLM using multimodal reasoning. step_preprocess() now also generates Quality Control (QC) plots. Add cast_data() fetch data glysmith_result object. name parameter specified cast_plot(), cast_table(), cast_data(), functions return names available objects. makes easier know objects available. Add modify_blueprint() modify blueprint using natural language.

title: glysmith 0.5.0
text: inquire_blueprint() now prints brief description blueprint console, instead explanation steps chosen. slight difference wording. Optimize prompt inquire_blueprint() let group steps using br(). Also, now understands step arguments can use needed. “Tables” section removed report. duplicated README.md file generated quench_result(). Add new vignette AI features.

title: glysmith 0.4.0
text: dynamic argument mechanism removed. Now can directly pass arguments step functions.

title: glysmith 0.4.0
text: Added br() creating branches blueprint. inquire_blueprint() also supports blueprints branches now. step_dea_limma() now support covariates paired comparison, via covariate_cols subject_col arguments.

title: glysmith 0.4.0
text: Fix issue blank lines printed console package first loaded one session. Update system prompt reflection strategy inquire_blueprint() make LLM work better. Fix dependency issue step_dea_kruskal(). Update Get Started vignette introduce br().

title: glysmith 0.3.1
text: Fix deployment issue r-universe.

title: glysmith 0.3.0
text: Added step_quantify_motifs() quantifying glycan motifs. Updated relevant steps support parameter motif_exp experiments. inquire_blueprint() now prints LLM-generated explanation console returning blueprint. inquire_blueprint() now supports exp argument, accepting glyexp::experiment() object, provide accurate, context-aware suggestions.

title: glysmith 0.3.0
text: Refined step documentation improve clarity optimize inquire_blueprint() performance. Enhanced error messages failed steps. Suppressed harmless warning quench_result() used step_pca(). Console messages step_pca() now include experiment name forge_analysis(). Moved several dependencies (pROC, Rtsne, uwot, EnhancedVolcano, org.Hs.eg.db, clusterProfiler, ggplotify, pheatmap, factoextra) “Suggests”. now automatically checked installed required blueprint steps.

title: glysmith 0.2.0
text: Add inquire_blueprint() use Large Language Model generate blueprint user prompt. Add step_tsne() t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding. Add step_umap() Uniform Manifold Approximation Projection. Add step_roc() Receiver Operating Characteristic analysis. step_pca() now also generates loading plot screeplot, besides individual plot. step_pca() (along newly added step_tsne() step_umap()) now parameter control experiment perform analysis .

title: glysmith 0.2.0
text: Update report content step_ident_overview(). adapt new glyexp::summarize_experiment() function introduced glyexp 0.11.0. Update blueprint_default(): step_ident_overview() now first step, step_preprocess(). Fix bug report content DEA step derived traits “NA vs NA” contrast. plot names, table names, step IDs changed consistent. Update documentations step functions better reflect usage. glysmith_result now data field store data generated blueprint.

title: glysmith 0.1.0
text: First GitHub release.
